Based on your preferences, I recommend "You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger". It is a science fiction film directed by Danny Boyle and starring Ben Kingsley, David Thewlis, and Jennifer Jason-Leigh.
The plot of the film revolves around three strangers who meet each other at a train station. They are each assigned to assist the others with various tasks such as packing luggage, finding directions, and handling emergencies.
As the days pass, the three strangers begin to realize that they have more in common than they originally thought. They share a sense of purpose and a desire to make a positive difference in the world around them.
In the end, the three strangers are able to come together and form a bond that will last for many years to come.

Based on the user's preferences and the list of movies they provided, I would recommend the movie "Frozen". This animated film tells the story of Elsa, a princess from the kingdom of Arendelle. When Elsa accidentally releases her magic in the form of ice, she is forced to flee Arendelle and live with her sister Anna in a remote mountain cabin.

Despite their differences, Elsa and Anna eventually come together and use their combined magical powers to defeat the evil ice troll prince Olaf.

In "Frozen", the story is told through the eyes of two sisters who are separated by fate. The film combines elements of traditional fairy tale stories with modern animation techniques. The film's plot is filled with twists, turns, surprises, and cliffhangers that keep audiences on the edge of their seats.

The movie received mixed reviews from critics, who praised the performances, particularly those of Zoe Levin, Jordan Trovillion, Noah Emmerich, and Daniel Stern. However, some critics also criticized the script, which they felt was not as well-written as some of Son's previous work. Overall, Trust (2010) is an engaging and thought-provoking movie that is sure to please fans of this genre.
